question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in New York by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in New York. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India impose new regulatory curbs on Canara Bank's lending by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announces new regulatory curbs specifically targeting Canara Bank's lending practices. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the RBI or reported by at least two major Indian financial news outlets (such as Economic Times, Mint, or Business Standard). question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). question.title: Will Virginia hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Virginia state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Virginia-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Virginia and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

question.title: Will the Alabama Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Alabama Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

- No such mission takes place by the specified date.

- The Orion spacecraft is utilized solely for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is a reduction in the interest rate by the Reserve Bank of India expected before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their official statement or press conference subsequent to a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual members of the RBI will not be sufficient for resolution. If no official announcement regarding an interest rate reduction is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Texas state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Belarus withdraw its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus publicly announces the withdrawal of its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the Belarusian government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The withdrawal must be a clear and unambiguous retraction of Belarus's application to join the organization, not merely a postponement or reconsideration. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Belarus joins the organization before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, AbbVie officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its rheumatoid arthritis drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. question.title: Will Moscow announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 World Cup venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a major AI research lab's chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major AI research lab's chatbot is spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will Mexico become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Mexico is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. question.title: Will Maple Leaf Foods issue a recall of deli meats due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Maple Leaf Foods officially announces a recall of any of its deli meat products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Maple Leaf Foods' website or social media channels
2. A press release from Maple Leaf Foods
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Maple Leaf Foods recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Microsoft's AI chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Utah Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Utah Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Utah legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially announced by the Texas Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of abortion rights protection. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will Swiss banking employees remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, banking employees in Switzerland are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from the banks, the unions representing the workers, or the Swiss government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Swissinfo, Neue Zürcher Zeitung, or Reuters). If the employees have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially announces an exceptional yield for both wheat and sunflowers, signifying yields that are above the average when compared to the previous five-year period. Verification must be obtained from official statements by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or from at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If an exceptional yield is declared for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not for both, or if no exceptional yield is reported for either crop, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Marta Rovira return to Spain and face a trial related to the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Marta Rovira returns to Spain and is officially put on trial for her involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Rovira physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. The charges must be directly related to Rovira's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. If no such trial begins by the specified date, or if Rovira is granted immunity or amnesty that prevents a trial from occurring, the question will resolve as NO. The resolution of this question is not dependent on the outcome of any potential trial.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Israel in response to military draft notices for ultra-Orthodox men by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Israel specifically in response to the Israeli military's decision to send draft notices to ultra-Orthodox men. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Israel. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of military draft notices for ultra-Orthodox men. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the draft notice policy is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, more than 23,000 minority artists have been confirmed to receive federal grants as part of a program addressing past discrimination. question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

This question will be considered TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, Bahrain's health ministry officially recognizes more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Recognition must come from official statements or reports from the Bahraini health ministry.
2. The recognition must be reported by at least two reliable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The specific type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are recognized by the specified date, or if only one case in total is recognized, the question will be determined as FALSE.

question.title: Will the U.S. government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

question.title: Will Indiana's voter pamphlets use the term 'unborn child' for the abortion ballot measure by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, official voter pamphlets distributed in Indiana for the abortion-related ballot measure include the term 'unborn child' or a closely related term (such as 'unborn human being') to refer to a fetus. The inclusion must be verified through official state documentation, announcements from the Indiana Secretary of State's office, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Indianapolis Star, Fort Wayne Journal Gazette). If the term is not used in the official pamphlets by the specified date, or if a court ruling definitively prohibits its use, the question will resolve as NO. This question does not consider unofficial pamphlets or campaign materials.

question.title: Will North Carolina's fast food industry employment decrease by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, official reports from North Carolina government labor statistics or major economic analysis firms indicate a decrease in the total number of employed individuals within the fast food industry in North Carolina compared to the most recent data available as of October 1, 2023. question.title: Will 'Dredd 2' be the highest-grossing R-rated movie by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if 'Dredd 2' remains the highest-grossing R-rated movie worldwide, not accounting for inflation, as of August 31, 2024. The ranking must be based on total box office earnings reported by at least two reputable sources such as Box Office Mojo, Variety, or The Hollywood Reporter. If any other R-rated movie surpasses its earnings by this date, or if 'Dredd 2' loses its top position at any point before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, only theatrical releases are considered, excluding any streaming or VOD revenues.

question.title: Will Indonesia officially declare an end to its current dengue outbreak by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Indonesian government or its official health authorities make a formal declaration that the dengue outbreak in Indonesia has ended. The declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) or by the World Health Organization (WHO). The declaration should specifically state that the dengue outbreak that began in 2023 has been contained or ended. If no such official declaration is made and reported by the specified date, or if the outbreak is still ongoing, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Larry Page on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Larry Page on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Larry Page must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

This inquiry will be answered with a YES if Elon Musk does not hold a live conversation with Larry Page on X (previously known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive outcome, at least one of the following criteria must be fulfilled:

1. The conversation is not conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk is not the main interviewer.
3. Larry Page is not the person being interviewed.
4. The event is not publicly announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The conversation is not made available to the public on the X platform.
6. Fewer than two major news organizations (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) cover the event either before or after it.

If any of these criteria are met by August 31, 2024, or if the conversation does not take place, the answer will be YES. Conversely, if none of these criteria are met by this date, the response will be NO.

question.title: Will a British citizen be released from Iranian custody by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if a British citizen currently held in Iran is released from Iranian custody by July 31, 2024. The release must be confirmed through official announcements from the Iranian or British governments, or reports from at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or The New York Times). Release means the citizen is no longer in detention and is free to leave Iran. Temporary releases for court appearances or medical reasons do not count. If the citizen remains in Iranian custody as of July 31, 2024, or if their status is unclear, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Apple's Siri be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Siri and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

The resolution will rely on official statements from Philippine officials or trustworthy news sources from a minimum of three major media outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, The Straits Times) verifying her release or house arrest at any point in July 2024. If she remains incarcerated in a standard correctional facility throughout the entire month of July 2024 without any form of release, the resolution will be negative. For the purposes of this question, 'prison' is defined as a conventional correctional facility, excluding house arrest or any type of modified confinement outside of a typical prison environment.

question.title: Will Wisconsin hold a referendum on mental health services funding by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Wisconsin conducts an official public referendum specifically focused on increasing funding for mental health services in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Wisconsin.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on mental health services funding.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Los Angeles announce a public transit-only policy for 2028 Olympic venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Los Angeles or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2028 Summer Olympics will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to Olympic venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Baidu's Apollo robotaxis be available on Uber's ride-hailing service by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Baidu's Apollo autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) are confirmed to be operational and available for passenger rides through Uber's ride-hailing service in at least one city. Confirmation must come from official statements by either Baidu or Uber, or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, TechCrunch). The service must be publicly accessible to regular Uber users, not just for testing or limited trials. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the partnership is canceled or indefinitely delayed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Xiaomi distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Xiaomi officially distributes its smartphones to North Korean athletes participating in the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. For a YES resolution, all of the following conditions must be met:

1. Xiaomi must proceed with the distribution despite any potential concerns about U.N. Security Council sanctions.
2. The distribution must be confirmed by official statements from Xiaomi, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), or relevant Olympic authorities.
3. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).

The question resolves as NO if any of the following occur:
1. Xiaomi officially announces that it will not distribute smartphones to North Korean athletes.
2. The distribution is officially halted or canceled before completion.
3. By August 31, 2024, there is no clear confirmation that the distribution to North Korean athletes has taken place.

Note: This question does not consider the legality or potential consequences of such a distribution, only whether it occurs.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the NASA budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Will Twitter announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Twitter publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Twitter only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO.
